talos_persecution_campaign.name: Talos Persecution Campaign

talos_persecution_campaign.completion_effect: Talos worship completely suppressed, shrines destroyed, worshippers imprisoned
story_hooks: At 5/10: Thalmor Justiciars patrol main roads
At 7/10: Bounties on Talos priests
At 9/10: Secret trials and executions
At 10/10: All public Talos worship eliminated

intelligence_network.description: Spy network gathering intelligence on threats to Aldmeri Dominion
intelligence_network.completion_effect: Comprehensive spy network, Thalmor know everything happening in Skyrim
advancement_triggers: Establish safe house or dead drop (+1)
setback_triggers: Agent exposed or killed (-1 per agent)

blades_elimination.name: Blades Elimination
blades_elimination.description: Hunt down and destroy the remaining Blades members
blades_elimination.completion_effect: The Blades are extinct, no organized resistance to Thalmor remains
setback_triggers: Sky Haven Temple discovered by Blades (-3)
story_hooks: Thalmor actively hunting Esbern
Dossiers on remaining Blades at embassy
Paarthurnax seen as Blades ally (indirectly)

dragon_crisis_investigation.name: Dragon Crisis Investigation
dragon_crisis_investigation.description: Thalmor attempts to understand and potentially exploit the dragon crisis
dragon_crisis_investigation.completion_effect: Thalmor understand dragon crisis and seek to manipulate it for Dominion benefit
story_hooks: Thalmor dossier on 'The Dragon Crisis' at embassy
No evidence Thalmor caused dragons (but investigated)
Thalmor want to know if rising champions are controllable
Dragons don't distinguish between factions

ulfric_manipulation.name: Ulfric Manipulation
ulfric_manipulation.description: Thalmor's covert influence over Ulfric Stormcloak to prolong civil war
ulfric_manipulation.completion_effect: Ulfric becomes unwitting Thalmor asset, civil war continues indefinitely
setback_triggers: Party shares embassy documents about Ulfric (-5)
Ulfric allies with Imperials against Thalmor (-6)

secret_information.dossier_contents: Ulfric is an 'asset' - questioned after Great War, released to cause instability. Contact established but dormant. Status: Uncooperative. Direct contact forbidden.
secret_information.thalmor_goal: Ulfric's rebellion serves Thalmor interests even though he opposes them
secret_information.risk: If Ulfric discovers manipulation, he may unite with Empire against Thalmor

ulfric_manipulation.gm_notes: This is revealed in Diplomatic Immunity. Ulfric is NOT a willing agent, but his rebellion benefits Thalmor.

thalmor_eye_of_magnus_operation.name: Thalmor Eye of Magnus Operation
thalmor_eye_of_magnus_operation.description: Ancano's mission to secure the Eye of Magnus for the Aldmeri Dominion. The Eye is an ancient artifact of immense power discovered at Saarthal by the College of Winterhold. Ancano, embedded as a 'cultural advisor,' seeks to control or extract it.
thalmor_eye_of_magnus_operation.completion_effect: Ancano successfully secures the Eye for the Thalmor, granting the Dominion reality-altering power and dominance over Skyrim's magical landscape
advancement_triggers: Eye of Magnus discovered at Saarthal (+2)
Eye transported to College Hall of Elements (+1)
Ancano gains unrestricted access to Eye (+1)
Ancano successfully attunes to the Eye (+2)
story_hooks: At 2/8: Ancano shows unusual interest in Saarthal expedition
At 4/8: Ancano begins studying the Eye intensely, College concerned
At 6/8: Ancano makes his move, seals College with magical barriers
At 8/8: Ancano harnesses Eye's power, reality begins to fracture
thalmor_eye_of_magnus_operation.connection_to_instability_clock: This clock advances the Eye Instability clock. As Ancano progresses, the Eye becomes more unstable.
thalmor_eye_of_magnus_operation.gm_notes: This clock tracks Ancano's progress toward weaponizing the Eye. It should escalate during the College questline. The climax (8/8) triggers the final confrontation. If players neglect this, Ancano succeeds and the campaign faces reality-warping consequences.

eye_of_magnus_instability.name: Eye of Magnus Instability
eye_of_magnus_instability.description: The Eye of Magnus is an artifact of such power that reality itself strains around it. The more it's studied, moved, or manipulated, the more unstable it becomes. Unchecked, it could cause a localized Dragonbreak or worse.
eye_of_magnus_instability.completion_effect: The Eye's power spirals out of control, creating magical anomalies, dimensional rifts, and potentially a Dragonbreak affecting Winterhold and beyond
advancement_triggers: Ancano attempts to attune to Eye (+2)
setback_triggers: Staff of Magnus used to stabilize Eye (-2)
Eye properly warded by College mages (-1)
Eye sealed or removed from Mundus (-3)
story_hooks: At 2/6: Magical anomalies appear near College—wards flickering, time distortions
At 4/6: Students and faculty report nightmares, reality feels 'thin'
At 5/6: Physical manifestations—objects phasing, gravity anomalies, spectral visions
At 6/6: Full breakdown—reality rifts, Eye attempting to tear open barriers between planes

environmental_effects.low_instability: Minor magical fluctuations, enhanced spell effects
environmental_effects.moderate_instability: Random magical surges, teleportation mishaps, summoned creatures appearing
environmental_effects.high_instability: Time loops, pocket dimensions, party experiencing alternate timelines
environmental_effects.critical_instability: Reality fracturing, potential Dragonbreak, Eye could consume College/Winterhold

eye_of_magnus_instability.connection_to_thalmor_clock: Ancano's manipulation (Thalmor Eye Operation clock) directly advances this clock.
eye_of_magnus_instability.gm_notes: This clock creates urgency and consequence for the College questline. Use environmental effects to show escalation. At 5-6 segments, the final confrontation becomes mandatory. This clock can justify high stakes and dramatic set pieces.

covert_operations.description: Multi-segment tracking for specific Thalmor operations with discovery, progress, and resolution states

operation_northern_silence.objective: Systematically eliminate all Blades survivors in Skyrim

discovery_state.description: How much players know about this operation
revelations: Segment 1: Hear rumors of Thalmor hunting someone
Segment 2: Find dossier mentioning 'Blades elimination'
Segment 3: Intercept kill order for specific Blade
Segment 4: Full operation plan discovered at Embassy
discovery_state.current_player_knowledge: Players know Thalmor seek someone, not yet identified as Blades hunt

progress_state.description: Thalmor progress toward eliminating all Blades
milestones: Segment 5: Assassination attempt on identified Blade (pending)
Segment 4: Protect Sky Haven Temple location
Segment 6: Eliminate Thalmor kill teams, operation abandoned

advancement: Time passes without intervention (+1 progress per 3 sessions)

Segment 6: Expose Thalmor to both sides publicly
Segment 8: Both sides unite against Thalmor threat

discovery_advancement: Embassy infiltrated - champions learn they're watched (+1 discovery)
progress_advancement: Champions show weakness or vulnerability (+1 progress)
Opportunity for recruitment or elimination arises (+2 progress)
resolution_advancement: Kill Thalmor agents hunting you (+1 resolution)

operation_eye_of_magnus.objective: Secure the Eye of Magnus artifact for the Aldmeri Dominion through Agent Ancano embedded at the College of Winterhold

discovery_state.description: Thalmor (and player) awareness of the Eye of Magnus
revelations: Segment 1: College begins excavation at Saarthal—routine monitoring
Segment 2: Ancano reports 'significant artifact' discovered
Segment 3: Eye transported to College—Ancano confirms reality-altering power

progress_state.description: Ancano's success in securing/controlling the Eye

Segment 6: Ancano seizes control—locks down College

resolution_state.description: Player/College success in stopping Ancano and securing Eye
milestones: Segment 2: Retrieve Staff of Magnus (key to disrupting Eye connection)
Segment 6: Defeat Ancano and stabilize Eye

discovery_advancement: Eye brought to College Hall of Elements (+1 discovery)
Ancano reports to Elenwen (+0 discovery for players, operation now active)
progress_advancement: Ancano gains access to Eye unsupervised (+1 progress)
College leadership distracted or weakened (+1 progress)
Ancano successfully attunes to Eye (+2 progress)
Players delay retrieving Staff of Magnus (+1 progress per delay)

College faculty unites against Ancano (+1 resolution)

connection_to_college_questline.hitting_the_books: Ancano intensifies interest, progress state begins
connection_to_college_questline.staff_of_magnus: Progress state advances rapidly, players gain resolution tool
connection_to_college_questline.eye_of_magnus_finale: Progress vs Resolution climax—outcome determines Eye's fate

thalmor_resources_committed.ancano: Deep cover agent, embedded for years, authorized to use any means
thalmor_resources_committed.embassy_support: Elenwen provides intelligence, magical resources, contingency plans
thalmor_resources_committed.reinforcements: If Ancano requests, Thalmor strike team can be dispatched (extreme measure)
thalmor_resources_committed.diplomatic_cover: If operation exposed, Thalmor deny knowledge, claim Ancano acted alone

failure_consequences.ancano_death: Major operational loss, Thalmor diplomatic incident
failure_consequences.psijic_intervention: If Psijic Order removes Eye, Thalmor completely lose access
failure_consequences.public_exposure: If operation revealed, major propaganda victory for Thalmor enemies

operation_eye_of_magnus.gm_notes: This operation is THE College questline hook for Thalmor. It escalates from background surveillance to existential crisis. Ancano is expendable—Elenwen authorized him to die if necessary to secure Eye. Use this to tie College storyline into broader Thalmor conspiracy. If players ignore College, Ancano may succeed, giving Thalmor reality-warping capabilities for rest of campaign.

gm_guidance.thalmor_as_villains: The Thalmor are sophisticated antagonists - not cartoon villains. They have legitimate grievances against the Empire and believe in High Elf superiority.
gm_guidance.moral_complexity: Some Thalmor truly believe they're bringing order. Others are cruel fanatics. Variety makes them interesting.
gm_guidance.player_interaction: Thalmor can be enemies, obstacles, or even temporary allies against greater threats (dragons). Their schemes should feel pervasive but not omnipotent.
gm_guidance.clock_progression: Advance Thalmor clocks slowly but steadily. Their plans are long-term. Major setbacks require significant player action.
gm_guidance.hold_influence_usage: Track Thalmor influence per hold to create regional variations. High influence holds have more patrols, arrests, and Thalmor presence. Players should notice difference between holds.
gm_guidance.multi_segment_tracking: Use discovery/progress/resolution states for operations. Discovery = what players know, Progress = Thalmor advancement, Resolution = player countermeasures. Allows operations to progress even when partially exposed.
gm_guidance.neglect_consequences: If players ignore Thalmor activities, consequences escalate automatically. Each hold has specific neglect triggers at influence levels 6, 8, and 10.

script_compatibility.faction_logic: Hold influence integrates with faction trust system
script_compatibility.gm_tools: All clocks and operations visible through GM clock viewer
script_compatibility.data_structure: Two formats coexist: (1) Traditional clocks in 'clocks' section use 'current_progress'/'total_segments' for backward compatibility. (2) Covert operations in 'covert_operations' section use cleaner 'current'/'segments' naming. Both are independently parseable.

balancing_tips: Don't advance all holds simultaneously - focus on 2-3 per arc
Use covert operations as story arcs spanning multiple sessions
Discovery state can advance even if progress is blocked
Resolution and progress states should oppose each other
Hold influence reflects both civil war outcomes and player action
Thalmor remember player interference - adjust tactics accordingly
gm_guidance.player_agency: Players should feel their actions matter. Rescuing Blades, exposing schemes, or defeating agents should have visible impact on clocks. Conversely, neglect should have consequences.

pacing_guidance.act_1: Establish Thalmor presence through patrols and minor incidents. Discovery states begin advancing.
pacing_guidance.act_2: Diplomatic Immunity reveals scope of schemes. Progress states advance unless countered. Hold influence becomes more visible.
pacing_guidance.act_3: Consequences of player choices manifest. Operations reach resolution or completion. Final confrontations possible.
